hints.title: How to Play:
hints.text: Drag the color chips from the Scrambled palette onto the game board square. Put the colors in order to form perfect gradient blends between the locked corner keys.

hints.title: Hint:
hints.text: Drag the chips around in the scrambled palette before placing them in the game board to cut down on mistakes that hurt your score.

hints.title: Did you know?
hints.text: Red and yellow are the most appetite-stimulating colors.

hints.title: Train your brain!
hints.text: You can replay a CHROMA level to improve your score. Keep practicing!

hints.title: Slow and Steady!
hints.text: Your score is calculated every time you drop a color chip on the board, so hang onto that color chip until you're sure you have it right!

hints.title: Color saves lives!
hints.text: The safest color to paint your car is lime-yellow for its high visibility in most driving conditions.

hints.title: I can't find my keys!
hints.text: Higher levels have missing Corner keys. Spot the keys in the scrambled pallette by looking for the purest colors.

hints.title: Color Math
hints.text: Blends between complementary colors are neutral gray in the center.

hints.title: What's your favorite color?
hints.text: The most popular color in the world is blue.

hints.title: Colorblindness affects more men than women
hints.text: 99% of all colorblind people are not really color blind but color deficient; the term color blindness is misleading.

hints.title: Don't wear red on exam day
hints.text: The color red is soothing for chickens, but it can increase anxiety in people because it is associated with failure.
